14.1: ...The workers are lazy and the reward is great. These are people that are lazy in their study of Torah. Even the righteous, quick Rabbis are lazy. Since it is in the nature of a human to be lazy and noone is free from this. Some are more and some are less.
14.0: Rabbi Tarfon said, the day is short and the work is great. The day is short- these are the his days that are short relative to the days of the Torah that are greater and longer than a land, white than the sea and there is no end.

0.1: Our Rabbis, may their memory be blessed said (Bava Kamma 30a) "One who wishes to be pious should fulfill the words of the Avot, and they said to him, the words of the damages". Since a person ascends the steps of piousness with doing one of these matters they placed the tractate Avot in the order of damages. For they also say to fulfil the words of Blessings which is in the order of Zeraim? Because it speaks of the blessings of seeds and fruits they placed it in that order. Futhermore, since it is the teachings of the Sanhedrin, they placed it in the order of the laws, for all the wise men mentioned here until Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai are from the Sanhedrin.
0.0: I will begin the commentary on "Avot" of our great, pious and holy rabbi, Rabbi Yonah the son of Rabbi Avraham, may he be remembered for blessing.
